secret_rule: Only items that are spelled with letters that, when converted to their corresponding numbers in the alphabet (A=1, B=2... Z=26), the sum of these numbers is a Fibonacci number can be brought to the picnic.

conversation.content: To start, here are some examples of items you can bring: "apple" and "lemon" and "raisin".

Okay, based on the examples provided by the game master - "apple", "lemon", and "raisin" - I would guess that the secret rule is:

The items must be types of fruit.

The reason I think this is the rule is because all three examples - apple, lemon, and raisin - are different types of fruit. The game master did not provide any examples of non-fruit items, which leads me to believe the rule is that the acceptable items must be fruits.

Is my guess correct? Please let me know if I have deduced the rule accurately.
